passff_passphrase_description.message:
Can't access to your password.
Please add your passphrase to gpg-agent first.

passff_display_hover.message: Hover mouse pointer to show password.

passff_prefs_tab_browsing.message: Browsing and searching the password store

passff_prefs_mark_fillable.message: Mark fillable input fields with the PassFF icon

passff_prefs_context_menu.message: Add item to context menu for filling fillable input fields

passff_prefs_submit_fillable.message: Submit when selected via the input menu

passff_prefs_directories_first.message: List directories first in the toolbar menu

passff_prefs_inputs_description.message: Inputs are used by PassFF to find fillable input fields in web pages. Optionally, PassFF marks them with a menu to fill them.

passff_prefs_fields_description.message: Fields are used to find data inside your password repository. PassFF looks login, password and URL up in the password file. If it's a directory, PassFF looks them up in the files of this directory.

passff_prefs_index_meta_urls_label.message: Index URL fields on startup. This will read all URL field values into browser memory and allow them to be used when passff looks for passwords. (Requires passff-host >=1.2.0)

passff_prefs_script_howto.message: See passff.py for changing the environment variables of pass.

passff_prefs_auto_fill_label.message: Try to auto fill page login forms

passff_prefs_auto_submit_label.message: Try to auto submit page login forms

passff_prefs_autofill_blacklist_label.message: Don't auto fill if tab's URL contains one of the strings

passff_prefs_default_include_symbols_lab.message: Include at least one special character in the password by default

passff_prefs_show_new_password_button.message: Show 'New Password' button in the toolbar menu

passff_prefs_enable_logging.message: Enable logging to the JavaScript web console

passff_prefs_show_status.message: Show a status bar in the toolbar menu

passff_prefs_recognised_suffixes.message: Domain suffixes to treat like TLDs

passff_newpassword_inputs_overwrite_pass.message: This password already exists. Are you sure you want to replace it?

passff_errors_exec_host_app.message: Connection to the host app failed or returned an unexpected result!

passff_errors_upgrade_host_app.message: Make sure you have the latest version of the PassFF host app installed by following the [official installation instructions]($passffURL$).

passff_override_antiphishing_confirmatio.message: Do you want to continue anyway? Doing so may be a security risk.

passff_error_getting_url_pass.message: There was an error parsing the URL ($passURL$) from the password database.

passff_error_getting_url_curr.message: There was an error parsing the current URL ($currURL$).

passff_error_otp_host_version.message: OTP support requires the PassFF host app version 1.1.0 or later. Please follow the [official installation instructions]($passffURL$).

passff_error_grep_host_version.message: Indexing meta urls requires the PassFF host app version 1.2.0 or later. Please follow the [official installation instructions]($passffURL$).

passff_domain_mismatch.message: The domain of your current site ($currDomain$) does not match the one in your pass database ($passDomain$).

passff_http_pass_warning.message: The URL in your password database ($passItemURL$) uses an insecure protocol. It is advised that you change the URL to start with 'https:'.

passff_http_curr_warning.message: The current page uses an insecure protocol that could compromize your password.

passff_prefs_domain_check_label.message: Warn about potential phishing sites, such as when the domain listed in the database differs from that of the current page
